alert.note: Alert for Cass; Mason; Menard (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 1:29PM CST until further notice by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Illinois... Sangamon River near Oakford affecting Menard, Cass and Mason Counties. .An ice jam remains in place along the Sangamon River near Oakford. This is causing water to infiltrate the agricultural, wooded, and grassy areas along the river. Rapid rises around and upstream of the jam are possible with fluctuations of 1-5 feet. Incoming precipitation may considerably add flow to the backed-up river reach and/or contribute to ice movement and potentially a break up. Be alert for rapid rises that can quickly filter downstream if ice does break up. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sangamon River near Oakford. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 471.0 feet, Flooding begins to agricultural areas not protected by levees. At 476.3 feet, Water overtops the South Sangamon East Levee. At 476.9 feet, Water reaches the top of Mason, Menard Special, and Oakford levees. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM CST Thursday the stage was 472.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:45 PM CST Thursday was 472.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 473.8 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 471.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Sangamon River Oakford 471.0 472.9 Thu 12 pm CS 473.3 473.7 473.8 &&
info.instruction: Persons with interests along this river need to remain aware of the latest forecasts and associated flood risk for their area. Stay tuned for further updates on this flooding situation. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
